abstract.p: Let r, s, n be integers satisfying 0 ≤ r < s < n, $s \ge n^\alpha $ , α > 1/4, and let gcd(r, s) = 1. Lenstra showed that the number of integer divisors of n equivalent to r (mod s) is upper bounded by O((α - 1/4)⁻²). We reexamine this problem, showing how to explicitly construct all such divisors, and incidentally improve this bound to $O((\alpha - 1/4)^{ - 3/2} )$ .
